ygData.subject: Re: Ebay..I can't believe it
ygData.msgSnippet: 1) I have never bought anything Everquest related on Ebay. However I have, in the past, used Ebay for other transactions. I have NEVER been ripped off. On rare
ygData.messageBody:
1) I have never bought anything Everquest related on Ebay. However I have,
in the past, used Ebay for other transactions. I have NEVER been ripped
off. On rare occasions, I know of people who have been. Ebay has ways of handling
these things. The chance of being ripped off on Ebay seems to be higher
in certain categories than others, though (beanie babies, furbies, I know
for sure)

I have also sold on Ebay. It is not ebay's fault that people are dishonest.

2) I believe Verant officially frowns on this practice. But there is
not a lo they can do to stop it.

Sarah heacock

On Thu, 29 Jul 1999, Patrick Myers wrote:

> From: "Patrick Myers" <chrisstauf@...>
>
> Has anybody seen what you can buy for Everquest on Ebay...if you want a
> laugh go to www.ebay.com in the search box type everquest *** where *** is
> your server name..ex "everquest karana". See what comes up. I saw 5000PP
> going for over $100.00..I also saw a bloodforge hammer going for
> $30.00...that's real money..I see them sell for around 30pp in the game..Am
> I to understand a Platinum is equivalant to a dollar..I could only
> dream...just thought everybody would get a kick out of that. What are your
> thoughts on this practice? Anybody have any nightmare stories about getting
> ripped off?
>
> Chrisstauf Lightbringer
> Cleric of the 12th circle
> Karana server
>
>
> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------

My picture of the world is of masses of people extending gifts to other
people, doing favors -- but nobody keeping score. -- Dr. Whitsett
